meanings.definition: A person who holds something jointly with another or others.
meanings.sent1: The coholders of the treasure shared the map to find it.
meanings.sent2: The coholders of the business made decisions together.
meanings.sent3: The coholders of the pizza argued over the last slice.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was like being coholders of a secret.
meanings.sent5: The coholders of the key had to turn it together to open the door.

meanings.definition: The act of holding something jointly with another or others.
meanings.sent1: The coholders of the rope pulled together to lift the box.
meanings.sent2: The coholders of the contract signed it simultaneously.
meanings.sent3: The coholders of the umbrella danced in the rain.
meanings.sent4: Their teamwork was like being coholders of a giant balloon.
meanings.sent5: The coholders of the trophy raised it high in victory.
